abstract: Islamic extremist Ahmad al-Faqi al-Mahdi, member of  jihadist group linked to Al Qaeda, pleads guilty at International Criminal Court to charges of destroying shrines and damaging mosque in Timbuktu, Mali; is court's first prosecution citing destruction of cultural heritage as war crime given intention to obliterate enemy’s history and identity.

headline.print_headline: Extremist Pleads Guilty to Destroying Cultural Sites in Mali
headline.main: Extremist Pleads Guilty in Hague Court to Destroying Cultural Sites in Timbuktu

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
